data.name: Rubiks cube CFOP algo : Cross
data.description:
This Kata is a part of the Rubiks cube solving series: [Rubiks party](https://www.codewars.com/collections/rubiks-party)

If you dont understand Rubiks notations take a look at this Kata:
[Rubiks Cube](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5b3bec086be5d8893000002e)

We will perform the first of the three steps of the CFOP algorithm of solving the cube.

You will be given a scrambled rubiks cube with the white face down facing D(own) (means the central piece of D is white) and blue facing L(eft).

You need to make a WHITE cross on the D(own) face of the cube.
Please note that the edge pieces should be aligned with the adjacent faces. The face aligment of the cube should not change (White down, Blue left)

valid cross:
```
      +-----+
      |. . .|
      |. y .|
      |. . .|
+-----+-----+-----+-----+
|. . .|. . .|. . .|. . .|
|. b .|. r .|. g .|. o .|
|. b .|. r .|. g .|. o .|
+-----+-----+-----+-----+
      |. w .|
      |w w w|
      |. w .|
      +-----+
```

NOT valid cross:
```
      +-----+
      |. . .|
      |. y .|
      |. . .|
+-----+-----+-----+-----+
|. . .|. . .|. . .|. . .|
|. b .|. r .|. g .|. o .|
|. o .|. b .|. r .|. g .|
+-----+-----+-----+-----+
      |. w .|
      |w w w|
      |. w .|
      +-----+
```


For more imformation you can search the web for the step 1 of the CFOP algorithm.

create the function `make_white_cross_on_B(state)`
'state' is a string representation of the cube. More on that in the previous kata [Rubiks Cube](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5b3bec086be5d8893000002e).

You need to return a string representation of turn needed to perform to achive the cross. e.g. `U F2 f R' D`

This is the whole list of possible rotations that the cube can perform:
```
F R U L D B F' R' U' L' D' B' F2 R2 U2 L2 D2 B2
M E S M' E' S' M2 E2 S2
f r u l d b f' r' u' l' d' b' f2 r2 u2 l2 d2 b2
X Y Z X' Y' Z' X2 Y2 Z2
```

If things get too hard to visualise, use the function `state_representation(state)` to print the current state nicely.

Best Solutions for the cross do not go over 8 moves (double moves like F2 count as one move). Can you achive this perfection?
